title: Things to Do in Derwent Valley
text:
Things to Do in Derwent Valley 2015-09-1  40.   United Kingdom Security   - based on 319 travel reports - by Kelly 0 vote(s) travel resume 
Derwent Valley is a perfect place to enjoy your next holiday. Whether you just want a weekend getaway or a more extended stay, Derwent Valley has a wide variety of activities for everyone in the family to enjoy. Come explore the rich culture and history whilst basking in the beautiful, picturesque scenery. Derwent Valley will make you fall in love with England and all it has to offer. 

Explore the Rich History 
Derwent Valley is known for its extensive culture and history. Best known for being an industrial powerhouse in the 18th century, Derwent Valley has a long list of historic sites to see. As you explore the history, you will have an opportunity to see how much Derwent Valley contributed to the world. 

First on the history list is the exploration of the historic Derwent Valley Mills World Heritage Site, which contains a group of historic mills along a valley in Derbyshire. These mills were once innovative and the home of the newest forms of technology. The mills of Derwent Valley were the first to produce cotton using a water-powered process. The process was one that would transform the way cotton was produced all over the world. Walking through the mills will give you a sense of how much industrial power this valley had, as well as an idea of the culture and experience of the hardworking labourers. 

Since the mills required extensive labour and long-term workers, it was most convenient for labourers to live nearby. As such, communities were built around the mills. As you explore the mills, you will also see the once vibrant communities that were constructed for the families of the labourers. The communities included churches and schools. Due to their success, the communities were duplicated across the world as a model for other cities. 

The Derwent Valley Mills and the associated communities are considered heritage sites, which means they have been preserved for cultural reasons. This gives tourists a great opportunity to learn about the legacy of the mill workers and the mills themselves by direct exposure to where they once lived. 

Derwent Valley’s history does not end with mills; it was also known for having some of the first railways in England. After exploring the mills and the nearby communities, you can also visit the museums that have exhibits about how the railways were constructed and how they were used to transport all kinds of items in and out of the towns. Catch a ride on the tram to see the various trails and where they pass. Derwent Valley continues to have excellent transportation, which is a reminder of how efficient and innovative the place once was. Clearly ahead of its time, Derwent Valley shows how strategic planning can create an industrial capital. 

In addition to the mills and the railways, Derwent Valley has several art museums with notable pieces of artwork. The art galleries offer a vast array of paintings, some of the beautiful landscapes, whilst others offer a depiction of life and the concerns at the time, including the debate between science and faith. You will find a variety of nature and everyday life in the mill community. 

Most of the historic museums and sites are quite informative and have special exhibits and gift shops. Not only will you get to learn about the history, but you can also take back a piece of it with you as memorabilia. Derwent Valley is a popular choice because it has a unique history unlike any other place in the world . You will be reminded of why England was such a pivotal force in the industrial revolution and you will have the opportunity to see a beautiful place. 

Immerse Yourself in Nature 
Derwent Valley is also well-known for its beauty. Situated in a picturesque countryside valley with mountains and beautiful landscape views, Derwent Valley is exquisite. The scenery is what makes Derwent Valley such a perfect place to come for a holiday. You will find yourself in awe of the breath-taking views. 

Surrounded by canals and rivers, Derwent Valley has a wide range of local wildlife, flora, and parks. Home to hundreds of species of birds and other wildlife, Derwent Valley does a great job of preserving and supporting its natural environment with over forty nature reserves. The parks are well maintained, giving you an opportunity to enjoy a day in nature. 

Lathkill Dale has waterfalls that you don’t want to miss. Other sites also offer some of the most beautiful flowers and gardens you have ever seen. Many of the gardens are also around playgrounds, creating a fun environment for the whole family. 

Cycling is a popular activity that many do when they are here in Derwent Valley. Cycle through the amazing trails to discover even more of the beautiful wildlife and natural scenery. Cycle hire is affordable and convenient. Come enjoy nature and be reminded of all the beautiful England countryside. 

Enjoy the Local Activities 
For those who are looking for entertainment, don’t worry, there are many local activities to enjoy in Derwent Valley. You will find pubs, shops, and local restaurants in the area as well. Take advantage of the delicious food and beer, as well as the local markets and shopping centres. There are also plenty of fun workshops available, such as painting classes and dancing. 

Many festivals are held throughout the year in Derbyshire. Medieval knight festivals, beer festivals, music festivals, and carnivals are offered continuously year-round. You’ll have an opportunity to experience more of the culture whilst being entertained and immersed with the locals. 

Overall, Derwent Valley offers a balance of history, culture, nature, and entertainment. There is something for everyone in the family to enjoy and there’s a wide variety of activities. You can explore the rich history embedded in the Derwent Valley Mills whilst immersing yourself in nature and having an opportunity to attend a local festival or two. You will never run out of enjoyable things to do. For ultimate relaxation, rejuvenation and fun, visit Derwent Valley. ...
